author: PATRICIA DODSON Tribune correspondent
title: Rivercrest has rough game, falls 40-22
text: Rivercrest Rebels line up on a first down against the Ore CIty Rebels. Posted: Saturday, September 26, 2015 1:46 am Rivercrest has rough game, falls 40-22 By PATRICIA DODSON Tribune correspondent dailytribune.net | 0 comments Rivercrest had a rough game Friday night at The Swamp as they fell 40-22. Ore City received the opening kickoff and Jarren Bray ran the ball to the 20 yard line. After several plays, Ore City scored the first touchdown of the evening with only 8:22 on the clock. The two-point conversion attempt failed, making the score 6-0. John King received the kick and brought the ball up to the 48 yard line. Riverecrest gained some ground and made it to third and ten on the 35 yard line, but Ore City made an interception and made a touchdown. However, a flag was called on the play and no score was given, but Ore City took possession of the ball at the 35 yard line. A few plays later, Ore City made a complete pass for a touchdown with 3:32 left on the clock in the first quarter. The point after attempt was no good. Triston Cain picked up the ball on the kickoff and gained 10 yards for the Rivercrest Rebels, making it first down on the 38 yard line. Rivercrest ran the ball for a one yard gain, making it second and nine. Cain picked up another 7 yards on the second play and made it third and two on the 40 yard line. An illegal procedure was called on the next play and the Rebels were pushed back to fourth and seven. With 1:33 on the clock, Cain punted the ball and Ore City took possession, ending the quarter with a score of 12-0. The second quarter started off great for the Rivercrest Rebels. At second and long, Ore City made a pass that was broken up by King. Ore City made a punt at fourth and nine, which was picked up by Cain who ran the ball 60 yards to score the first Rivercrest touchdown. The two-point conversion was denied. With only 11:56 on the clock, Rivercrest closed the gap 12-6. The rest of the quarter did not see any more points for Rivercrest. King made a solo tackle on the third down, forcing Ore City back three yards. On the next play, Ore City obtained a first down and an official timeout was called for an injured player. TJ Sessums, who made the tackle, had to be helped off the field. Ore City scored a short time later and made a complete pass for the two-point conversion, making the score 20-6. With 4:19 on the clock, Campbell scored again for Ore City but the point after attempt was no good. On the return kick Jayden Townes ran the ball past midfield to the 44 yard line. On the following play Cain ran the ball to the 28 yard line, but there was a penalty flag for holding and Rivercrest had to replay the first down. Cain made the first down, but after a series of incomplete passes Ore City took over at the 45 yard line. Ore City called a time out with 1:00 left in the quarter. A third and long complete pass resulted in fourth and twelve. Another timeout was called by Ore City and on the next play they scored a touchdown. The after point attempt was no good. The Rivercrest Rebels left the half down by 26 points with a score of 32-6. In the beginning of the third quarter, Rivercrest returned ready for action. Trenton Lee made a solo tackle. A few plays later, Ore City scored a touchdown and made a successful two-point conversion, bringing the score to 40-6. Shortly after the return kick Rivercrest fumbled and turned the ball over to Ore City. The Rivercrest Rebels made a recovery, though, when Townes picked up an Ore City fumble for a touchback in the last minute of the quarter, which ended with a score of 40-6. Rivercrest fought hard and made a comeback in the last quarter. The Rivercrest Rebels closed up the gap in the score and stopped Ore City from gaining anymore points. However, the Rivercrest Rebelâ€™s efforts fell just short, ending the game 40-22.
